net.sf.mmm.client.ui.gwt.widgets

Class AbstractTableCellAtomic

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
        • com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel
          • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.gwt.widgets.SingleCompositePanel
            • net.sf.mmm.client.ui.gwt.widgets.AbstractTableCellAtomic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.HasAttachHandlers, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasVisibility, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets.ForIsWidget, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.IsWidget, Iterable<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>, AttributeReadColumnSpan, AttributeReadRowSpan, AttributeReadText, AttributeWriteColumnSpan, AttributeWriteRowSpan, AttributeWriteText, SingleChildPanel
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TableCellAtomic, TableCellHeaderAtomic

    public abstract class AbstractTableCellAtomic
extends SingleCompositePanel
implements AttributeWriteColumnSpan, AttributeWriteRowSpan, AttributeWriteText
    A AbstractTableCellAtomic is a SingleCompositePanel that represents a table cell in a TableRow. It only supports a single child.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Detail

      • getColumnSpan

        public int getColumnSpan()
        This method gets the number of columns spanned by this object (cell). This cell expands to that number of cells horizontally so a value greater than 1 indicates that the next cells to the right are connected.
        Specified by:
        getColumnSpan in interface AttributeReadColumnSpan
        Returns:
        the column span. By default 1.

      • setColumnSpan

        public void setColumnSpan(int columnSpan)
        This method sets the columnSpan attribute.
        ATTENTION:
        Please note that this is the number of columns spanned by this object (and not the number of columns to join). This means the default value is 1 and not 0. To join with the next column, you need to provide the value 2.
        Specified by:
        setColumnSpan in interface AttributeWriteColumnSpan
        Parameters:
        columnSpan - is the new value of AttributeReadColumnSpan.getColumnSpan(). Should be at least 1. As 1 is the default, a typical value will be greater than 1.
        See Also:
        AttributeReadColumnSpan.getColumnSpan()

      • getRowSpan

        public int getRowSpan()
        This method gets the number of rows spanned by this object (cell). This cell expands to that number of cells vertically so a value greater than 1 indicates that the next cells to the bottom are connected.
        Specified by:
        getRowSpan in interface AttributeReadRowSpan
        Returns:
        the row span. By default 1.

      • setRowSpan

        public void setRowSpan(int rowSpan)
        This method sets the rowSpan attribute.
        ATTENTION:
        Please note that this is the number of row spanned by this object (and not the number of rows to join). This means the default value is 1 and not 0. To join with the next row, you need to provide the value 2.
        Specified by:
        setRowSpan in interface AttributeWriteRowSpan
        Parameters:
        rowSpan - is the new value of AttributeReadRowSpan.getRowSpan(). Should be at least 1. As 1 is the default, a typical value will be greater than 1.
        See Also:
        AttributeReadRowSpan.getRowSpan()

      • getText

        public String getText()
        This method gets the text of this object. The text attribute is more generic (or less specific) as label or title.
        Specified by:
        getText in interface AttributeReadText
        Returns:
        the text. Will be the empty string if no text has been set.
